Very hacky and this is a simplified version of what I did:
Make the field hidden in the form settings, then use css/js to show the label and container again (but don’t unhide the field)
Then append this line which creates a date field with just the native browser date picker
```<input type="date" required pattern="\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}" placeholder="yyyy-mm-dd">```
(the pattern and placeholder is for ie that doesn’t support date fields and requires the format yyyy-mm-dd modern browsers will have a datepicker in the users browser format)

then run some js on change event to update the hidden field value with the new field value.

I guess you may be able to just show the hidden field and change the attributes then you won’t have to do the on change js
